Posts.Content:
Hi ! I'M Dee and I'm 83. I would be a five year survivor of cancer but lately I've been having some swelling and seems like more lumping in my left breast. I had a lump and 19 nodules removed. I had chemo-radiation.Yesterday I had a mammogram and than they had me have an ultra sound. Then I was told to do a follow up with my doctor.It takes 48 hours to get test back. That should be around noon tomorrow. It sounds like I have a problem as if the mammogam was ok I did'nt need the ultra sound. They did measurements and I did'nt understand what they were talking about
. Anyway it's a scary night for me. I thought this would be a great place to get my feelings out. thank you all. Hug!
Posts.Title: Waiting for answers

Posts.Content: Hi! I had a lumpectomy and had 19 lymph nodes removed. It's been over a year and I am having swelling in the left breast (the one I had the lumpectomy on). I also ache and have some tingling in my arm. I love to crochet and I think this my be what's causing it. I'm going to stop the crocheting for awhile. I was wondering if anyone else has had this problem? Also so wonder if it will always be this way. Very disappointing! Best to all, Dee
Posts.Title: Breast swelling

Posts.Content: Thanks for reply Bev. I saw the nurse practioner the other day and she said it wasn't lymphadema. They took a blood test and I will see the oncologist Monday. I stopped the crocheting for now, but still have the problem. I think I have just overdone everything and it may take awhile for the aching to go away. Everything else is fine and I hope your doing well. The best too you, Dee
Posts.Title: Breast swelling

Posts.Content: Thanks Judy. Dee
Posts.Title: message from medicare

Posts.Content: Hi all! I've had 35 radiation treatments. I have been having ringing in my ears and wondered if it was from the radiation. My breast and underarm are burnt and uncomfortable, I keep Eucerin lotion and
Posts.Title: Tinnitus, anyone!

Posts.Content: Hi All!
Posts.Title: Stage IV breast cancer survivors

Posts.Content: Hi cdj! Here's another hug. Try to keep busy. Maybe call friends or relatives and chat. Seems like health issues always happen on weekends. Let us know your results. Wishing you the best. Dee
Posts.Title: looking for help and support

Posts.Content: Hi All! I've had chemo (toxatere, carboplatin, herceptin). I had 35 radiation treatments. I have a couple of more herceptin treatments and I think thats it. I went to the dentist before my treament to make sure my teeth were okay. They were. I went to the dentist the other day and he found 6 cavities and some are under crowns. He's going to talk too my oncologist and maybe they'll wait until my treaments are over and my port is removed before he works on my teeth. I'll know Monday. What a bummer!!!! I'm not sure what he'll do, but it's going to be a fortune and I believe it has something to do with the chemo and radiation. Hope your all doing fine. I refuse to let this get me down. :>) Dee
Posts.Title: Herceptin and teeth

Posts.Content: I received a copy of a letter from Medicare that they sent to my radioligist. They said that they were not paying for 2 of the treatments. That they were not neccessary and uncalled for and I had too many in to short of time. I had 35 treatments. I am not liable because there was no way I would know unless they told me Medicare would not pay. I wonder how Medicare knows what you need and then on the other hand did I get to much radiation. Anyone have a letter like this?
Posts.Title: message from medicare

Posts.Content: Thank you, Lori and Bev. The information is really helpful. I don't feel so alone when there's a website like this that is so reassuring. Hugs to all. Dee
Posts.Title: Infilterating ductal carcinoma

Posts.Content:
So sorry to hear about
 your friend. I lost my sister a week ago. She had surgery for colon cancer and came through that ok, but the next day she had a heart attack and died. Like you say life isn't fair. I'm battling her2 breast cancer and it really scares me. I'll say a prayer for your friend Bernadette. Hugs, Dee
Posts.Title: Lost another angel to this d@%& disease

Posts.Content:
MK,
Thanks for your reply. Now I feel that it's normal to have these numb feelings and can expect for them to hang around. Hugs, Dee
Posts.Title: numb upper arm

Posts.Content:
Hi Jean! I'm also glad your getting a second opinion. You may be just fine, but I had a lump in my left breast that was real near my armpit. It grew real fast, so I went in to the regular doctor and he said he wanted it taken out even if it wasn't cancerous, because it was near my lymph nodes.  Well, it turned out that I had HER2 cancer, but no cancer in the lymph nodes. I had a lumpectomy, than chemo and now I'm having radiation. I will take Herceptin for a year. I'm doing fine. Going everyday for radiation gets old, but it doesn't hurt. I pray you don't have cancer, but just knowing what the lump is about
 will ease your mind. Hugs, Dee
Posts.Title: Underarm Lump

Posts.Content: Granny Mac! Thanks for all the info on tne computer. Sounds like your a whiz. I had my lumpectomy Wednesday. They took ten exrays and couldn't get a good reading. The surgeon was able to find a few and I'll know the results the first of the week. Surgery wasn't to bad, but I don't care for the little bulb that I wear. Oh well. it's only a few days.I see the oncologist on the 19th of August. Hugs to all, Dee
Posts.Title: Infilterating ductal carcinoma

Posts.Content: Hi All! I had a lumpectomy in August. The upper part of my left arm is still numb to touch. I have a lump that feels like muscle under my arm near my surgery. I wonder if it might be scare tissue or something to do with the 19 lymph nodes they removed? I'll see the onc Monday. It's a worry! Best to all, Dee
Posts.Title: numb upper arm

Posts.Content: Hi All!
Posts.Title: Cancer reaccurance

Posts.Content: I had an ultrasound guided breast biopsy on July 10. It was not bad at all. They deadend the skin and after applied a small sugrie-strip. I have a little discomfort, but it isn't constant. Sad to say I have what is called infilterating ductal carcinoma grade 3 0f 3. Whatever all that means. I see the breast surgeon Wednesday. My daughter will be here to go with me. I have a surgeon that specializes in breast surgery. That helps. I pray it's not in my lymph nods. Best of luck on your biopsy and also to your husband. Dee
Posts.Title: Surgical Biopsy

Posts.Content:
I have infilterating ductal carcinoma grade 3 of 3. I see a breast surgeon Wednesday. I am so worried about
 having chemo first or even after. I am 79 and wondering if they might consider my age and go another route. Has anyone my age gone through this and  how did they handle it? Thanks, Dee
Posts.Title: Infilterating ductal carcinoma

Posts.Content: Hi all! I met my surgeon yesterday. I'm going to have a lumpectomy on Tuesday. They will take out a couple of lymph nodes and examine them. It will depend on them as to rather they'll take out more nodes. My surgeon says that my type of cancer responds well to chemo. I'll meet with an oncologist in 3 wks. Between the surgeon, oncologist and a nurse, we'll discuss what would be the best option for me. My daughters will be with me. I'm hanging in there. Lots of hugs to all, Dee
Posts.Title: Infilterating ductal carcinoma

Posts.Content: Nice to hear from you MK. I think all we oldies should be computer savvy. It keeps our brain active. I have a large rose garden and I take photos of the roses. I use the computer to make my greeting cards with the photos. I lost my husband to lung cancer and the computer has become my companion, after my American Eskimo of course ! Haha. Hugs, Dee
Posts.Title: Infilterating ductal carcinoma

Posts.Content: Dee, 79, Colorado Springs,CO. Just diagnosed with infilterating ductal carcinoma grade 3 of 3. See surgeon Wednesday.
Posts.Title: ROLL CALL name, age, state and any other info to share
